attributes.action: review the £8000 tax relief on company relocation assistance set by Norman Lamont in 1992. Costs associated with buying a house are dramatically higher than in 1992 and the relief should be increased in line with associated costs. The limit should be higher than £25K.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The costs associated with relocating for an existing or new job are very significant and the £8000 tax relief is completely inadequate for most needs. The relief doesn't even exempt the payment of stamp duty by the company, which is often well in excess of £8K itself. The govenment should be encouraging people to live where they work and not commuting because the cost of relocating is too high and any assistance over £8K is taxed as income.

Relocating to live where you live should be encouraged not penalised.
